prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.4256, 0.0]. First, create the 2D sketch. It will be drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch will have one face (face\\_1) and the following loop (loop\\_1) on that face: 1. line\\_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.7239] 3. line\\_3: Start Point = [0.75, 0.7239], End Point = [0.0, 0.7239] 4. line\\_4: Start Point = [0.0, 0.7239], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Now, let's scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale scaling parameter. Since sketch\\_scale is set to 0.75, scale the loop according to the factor by multiplying the End Point coordinates of each line in the loop by 0.75. For example, the new End Point of line\\_1 will become [0.0, 0.0] and [0.5625, 0.0]. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the saved euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrude depth towards the normal will be 0.4256, and the extrude depth opposite the normal will be 0.0. The sketch\\_scale used earlier is 0.75. The operation for this part is a "New Body Feature Operation", meaning this part is a new solid body that we are creating. The dimensions of the shape are: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.4256 * Height: 0.75</description>
